long_description: Built to keep your feet warm and comfortable, the women's Nordica Cruise 65 ski boots are a great choice for fun on the mountain this season. As compared to men's liners, women-specific liners feature extra padding in the tongues, more insulation throughout and contoured top edges designed to fit women's calves. Dual-density plastic maximizes ease of entry regardless of temperature; even if you have high insteps, getting your foot in the boot is hassle free. Soft shell flaps make it easy to get your foot in the boot; no more standing on 1 foot, hunching over, forcing your instep between 2 unforgiving, pinching plastic flaps. Liners snugly wrap the feet in cushioning foam and warm fleece lining; closed-cell foam against the shell enhances warmth. Liners provide a personalized fit around heel, ankle and center of foot when custom molded. Footbeds optimize foot position to create an effortless skiing stance, and they offer easy support for comfortable wear all day long. Upper buckle features a ladder that changes position to ease closure of the top portion of the boot; ladder changes position without the use of tools. Top of the boot a little tight? Cuffs feature an adjustable hex nut that increases the circumference of the top of the boot by 3 - 5mm and relaxes the angle of the boots. Power straps adjust cuffs for snugness and pressure against the shins. With a flex index of 65, Nordica Cruise 65 ski boots provide light resistance against a forward lean, appropriate for most recreational skiers. Extra-wide last accommodates forefoot measurements up to 104mm.
